unnormalised: New Delhi – Telecom operators are significantly accelerating Fiber-to-Home (FTTH) deployments across India, aiming to meet the surging demand for high-speed internet. This expansion is particularly noticeable in tier-2 and tier-3 cities, bridging the digital divide.
normalised: New Delhi – Telecom operators are significantly accelerating Fiber-to-Home (F T T H) deployments across India, aiming to meet the surging demand for high-speed internet. This expansion is particularly noticeable in tier-two and tier-three cities, bridging the digital divide.

unnormalised: Reliance Jio and Bharti Airtel are leading the charge, with aggressive rollout plans in regions like Uttar Pradesh and Bihar. Analysts at ICRA estimate investments in FTTH infrastructure to exceed Rs. 20,000 crore this fiscal year.
normalised: Reliance Jio and Bharti Airtel are leading the charge, with aggressive rollout plans in regions like Uttar Pradesh and Bihar. Analysts at I C R A estimate investments in F T T H infrastructure to exceed rupee twenty thousand crore this fiscal year.

unnormalised: Dr. Rajesh Kumar, a telecom analyst at IIT-Kanpur, notes, "FTTH provides significantly better bandwidth and reliability compared to traditional copper-based networks, crucial for supporting bandwidth-intensive applications like streaming and online education."
normalised: Doctor Rajesh Kumar, a telecom analyst at I I T-Kanpur, notes, "F T T H provides significantly better bandwidth and reliability compared to traditional copper-based networks, crucial for supporting bandwidth-intensive applications like streaming and online education."

unnormalised: The government’s BharatNet project is also playing a pivotal role, connecting gram panchayats with fiber optic cables. Recent reports suggest that over 1.5 lakh km of optical fiber cable has been laid under the initiative.
normalised: The government’s BharatNet project is also playing a pivotal role, connecting gram panchayats with fiber optic cables. Recent reports suggest that over one point five lakh kilometer of optical fiber cable has been laid under the initiative.

unnormalised: The growth in FTTH is expected to fuel demand for smart home devices and services, impacting sectors like home security and entertainment. Companies are already witnessing increased subscriptions in apartment complexes averaging 1200 sq ft. This rapid expansion is set to transform the Indian telecommunications landscape.
normalised: The growth in F T T H is expected to fuel demand for smart home devices and services, impacting sectors like home security and entertainment. Companies are already witnessing increased subscriptions in apartment complexes averaging one thousand two hundred square feet. This rapid expansion is set to transform the Indian telecommunications landscape.
